decks.notes: The key theme of this deck is to control the game through the use of planeswalkers and various control spells. The deck focuses on using powerful planeswalkers like Dack Fayden, Narset, Parter of Veils, and Oko, Thief of Crowns to manipulate the game state and disrupt the opponent's strategy. Additionally, the deck includes a variety of control spells such as Flusterstorm, Force of Will, and Force of Negation to counter and remove threats. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's strategy and provide a stable mana source.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with creatures that can be easily brought back to the battlefield, such as Vengevine and Squee, Goblin Nabob, using cards like Bazaar of Baghdad and Serum Powder. The deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early in the game through aggressive plays with cards like Blazing Rootwalla and Hollow One. The deck also includes powerful disruption cards like Force of Will and Force of Negation to protect its game plan and control the opponent's moves.

This deck aims to disrupt opponents with powerful counterspells and removal while deploying threats like Tarmogoyf and True-Name Nemesis to apply pressure. It also utilizes disruptive creatures like Collector Ouphe and Leovold, Emissary of Trest to disrupt opponents' strategies. The deck also has access to powerful draw spells like Ancestral Recall and Treasure Cruise to maintain card advantage. Overall, the deck focuses on a proactive game plan that disrupts opponents' strategies while efficiently deploying threats to close out the game quickly.

This deck focuses on using the Doomsday combo to win the game quickly by stacking the top of your library in a specific order. It utilizes powerful card draw and selection spells, along with counterspells and tutors, to set up the perfect Doomsday pile. The win condition often involves using Thassa's Oracle to win the game once the Doomsday pile is resolved. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Daze, Force of Will, and Flusterstorm to protect the combo. The goal is to efficiently assemble the combo and win before your opponent can disrupt your plan.
